holidays.name: National Chocolate Covered Raisin Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to enjoying the sweet, chewy treat of chocolate-covered raisins — a perfect blend of fruit and chocolate!
holidays.origin: Originated as a fun food day to celebrate the popular snack, no specific founder but embraced by confectionery enthusiasts.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate-covered raisins were once dubbed 'Nature’s Candy' because they combine the health benefits of fruit with the indulgence of chocolate!

holidays.name: World Tuberculosis Day
holidays.description: An important awareness day to raise public health attention on the global fight against tuberculosis (TB), a serious infectious disease.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the discovery of the TB bacterium by Robert Koch on March 24, 1882.
holidays.funFact: TB was once known as 'consumption' due to the severe weight loss it caused in patients.

holidays.name: Puppy Day
holidays.description: A heartwarming day to celebrate puppies and encourage adoption of furry friends in need of a forever home.
holidays.origin: Created by animal lovers and advocates to spotlight the joy and companionship puppies bring.
holidays.funFact: Puppies open their eyes for the first time about two weeks after birth, opening up a whole new world of curiosity and mischief!

holidays.name: Berry Hunting Day
holidays.description: An unofficial quirky celebration where enthusiasts hunt for wild berries or enjoy berry-themed treats.
holidays.origin: Celebrated by nature lovers and berry fans who appreciate the thrill of foraging and tasting fresh berries.
holidays.funFact: Wild berries have served as an important food source for humans and wildlife for thousands of years.
